<Helmet>
  <script src="https://kickstartdemo-dev.csid.us/eps/eps-core.js"></script>
  <script src="https://kickstartdemo-dev.csid.us/eps/eps-credit-score-module.js"></script>
</Helmet>

# Getting Started with Web

This page will help you get started embedding Experian's components into your site.


<ThemeDemo />

---

## Overview

The Credit Score Module is a visualization allowing the user can see their latest credit score as well as
see their credit score history at a high level. The Credit Score Module can display the
Credit Score Wheel or the Credit Score Plotter or both in one convenient module.

<credit-score-module token="eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..OXrWITFEHvLKOiQEvm7rOOLoBSca1AlWHHP7VQstTPE"></credit-score-module>

<iframe
  src="https://kickstartdemo-dev.csid.us/blank.html"
  width="650"
  height="470"
  title="Example Component"
  scrolling="no"
  frameborder="0"
></iframe>

## Web Component Integration

To get started, add the following two scripts to the head tag of your site. The first script is
the EPSCore library that contains all the logic for the modules. The second is the Credit Score Module
specific script. You can also download the [latest version of the library](https://t23-thirteen23-com.s3.amazonaws.com/eps/eps-library.1.0.0.zip) locally.

```html
<head>
  <script src="https://kickstartdemo-dev.csid.us/eps/eps-core.js"></script>
  <script src="https://kickstartdemo-dev.csid.us/eps/eps-credit-score-module.js"></script>
</head>
```

Next, add the Credit Score Module HTML tag into your site where you want it to render.

```html
<credit-score-module token="{YOUR_TOKEN_HERE}"></credit-score-module>
```

A user token is the only required property to get the default module to render.
There are a number of other properties that can be used to customize various aspects of the module.
A full list of editable properties are available in the [Styling Web Components](./styling.mdx) section.

Once you have both scripts tags in the head of your site and the module tag bested in the body of your
page, you should be able to render the module. Remember, you need a valid user token. If you want to
know more about obtaining a valid user token, visit the API docs. If you do not have a valid token and
wish to test out the module, feel free to use the following sandbox token:

```
eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..OXrWITFEHvLKOiQEvm7rOOLoBSca1AlWHHP7VQstTPE
```

## Next Steps

You should now be able to see the rendered Credit Score Module on your site. For further information about
the other properties that can be configured for this module, please see the [Styling Web Components Credit](./styling.mdx) section.
